title: College majors with the highest unemployment rates in the U.S. 2012
summary: The College majors in the highest unemployment was College Miscellaneous_Computer , who made 12.3 unemployed .
The most majors College was Political_Science_and_Government , with just 9.8 unemployed .

In second place was College Computer_and_Information_Systems with 12.1 unemployed ; third place went to College International_Business with 12.3 unemployed ; fourth place went to College Economics with 9.8 unemployed and fifth place went to College Anthropology_and_Archeology , who was 10.9 unemployed .
gold: This statistic shows college majors with the highest unemployment rates in the United States between 2009 and 2012 . The rate of unemployment for students with an international business major stood at 12.3 percent in 2012 .
